item.title: How i make it?
item.dc:creator: @kesa28 kesa28
item.description:
@kesa28 wrote:

thanks i try now it.[br][size=1]Posted on: November 01, 2007, 12:07:43 AM[/size][hr][quote=“xx nub xx, post:7, topic:155983”]personally i like the command approach to skillcapes… and no not just a spawn command

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("skillcape1"))
{	
if (getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]) == 100)
{
addItem(10705, 1);
addItem(10706, 1);
}
if (getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]) == 100)
{
addItem(10708, 1);
addItem(10709, 1);
}

}

{

addItem(10721, 1);
}
if (getLevelForXP(playerXP[7]) == 100)

addItem(10760, 1);
}
if (getLevelForXP(playerXP[8]) == 100)
{
addItem(10765, 1);
addItem(10766, 1);
}
if (getLevelForXP(playerXP[9]) == 100)
{
addItem(10741, 1);
addItem(10742, 1);
}
}

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("skillcape2"))
{
if (getLevelForXP(playerXP[10]) == 100)
{
addItem(10756, 1);
addItem(10757, 1);
}
if (getLevelForXP(playerXP[11]) == 100)

addItem(10763, 1);

}
if(playerLevel[7] >= 100 && playerLevel[8] >= 100 && playerLevel[9] >= 100 && playerLevel[10] >= 100 && playerLevel[11] >= 100 && playerLevel[12] >= 100 && playerLevel[13] >= 100 && playerLevel[14] >= 100 && playerLevel[15] >= 100 && playerLevel[16] >= 100 && playerLevel[17] >= 100 && playerLevel[20] >= 100) {
addItem(10770, 1);
addItem(10771, 1);
}
}

only gives you the cape if your level in that skill is maxed out… and quest cape is skiller cape meaning unless you are maxed in every non combat skill, you cant get it… but everyone has their likes and dislikes[/quote]

item.description:
@dog_eats_dog wrote:

[quote=“pimpownage, post:8, topic:155983”]you mak a big deal over the tiniest thing? why dont you leave the forums if your so interested in
dissing people on a forum? you seem like 10 too be having a cry over me trying to help this guy, and ur shop maker does not work for me. so why dont you GTFO.

xx nub xx that seems pretty good i like that :)[/quote]

Im not, I no my program aren’t perfect, But then, Whos is? And dissing a guy on the forums? You will to, Every one does, From ikiliki to silab.

Are you calling them 10 year olds? Cause if you are you need to get your brain checked, Personally, You need to get it checked now.

And if it doesn’t work for you, Sucks to be you.

And yes, Nub nice command.

personally i like the command approach to skillcapes… and no not just a spawn command

{

{
addItem(10705, 1);
addItem(10706, 1);

item.title: How i make it?
item.dc:creator: @dog_eats_dog dog eats dog
item.description:
@dog_eats_dog wrote:

[quote=“pimpownage, post:5, topic:155983”]shop = 8 @gre@Skill Capes 2 2 10705 1000 10708 1000 10711 1000 10714 1000 10717 1000 10720 1000 10723 1000 10726 1000 10729 1000 10732 1000 10735 1000 10738 1000 10741 1000 10744 1000 10747 1000 10750 1000 10753 1000 10756 1000 10759 1000 10762 1000 10765 1000 10768 1000 10770 1000 11981 1000 11824 1000 11997 1000 11998 1000 11999 1000 11268 10 10232 1000

thats my code, for one of my skillcape shops you add that into shops.cfg and then go into autospawn.cfg and put in coords of where it will be then in client java search for an existing shop, and add in somewhere the same with the id number 8 and the NPCid that’s how i did it P.S check that the number 8 isn’t used in ur autospawn.cfg.

dog ur utility is useless, i tryed to use it and it didn’t do anything helpfull.[/quote]

Uh hu, Your the only fool who is complaining about it, And obviously you have a sucky computer, Cause you either hate my Shop maker and Command Generator, Or you can’t read batch

If you can’t see them cause your computer sucks, Leave the forums and get a new computer

If you hate them, Make your own without leeching of mine a bit, It will have so many glitches and errors, It won’t work.

Now please, GTFO.

Read full topic

item.title: How i make it?
item.dc:creator: @pimpownage pimpownage
item.description:
@pimpownage wrote:

shop = 8	@gre@Skill Capes				2	2	10705	1000	10708	1000	10711	1000	10714	1000	10717	1000	10720	1000	10723	1000	10726	1000	10729	1000	10732	1000	10735	1000	10738	1000	10741	1000	10744	1000	10747	1000	10750	1000	10753	1000	10756	1000	10759	1000	10762	1000	10765	1000	10768	1000	10770	1000	11981	1000	11824	1000	11997	1000	11998	1000	11999	1000	11268	10	10232	1000

thats my code, for one of my skillcape shops you add that into shops.cfg and then go into autospawn.cfg and put in coords of where it will be then in client java search for an existing shop, and add in somewhere the same with the id number 8 and the NPCid that’s how i did it P.S check that the number 8 isn’t used in ur autospawn.cfg.

dog ur utility is useless, i tryed to use it and it didn’t do anything helpfull.

Read full topic

item.title: How i make it?
item.dc:creator: @dog_eats_dog dog eats dog
item.description:
@dog_eats_dog wrote:

[quote=“kesa28, post:3, topic:155983”]1. OK
2. i have silabsoft source
3. what now ?[/quote]

  1. Use my shop maker, And when you get to Item ID Type the skill capes id, Only one.

  2. Keep doing that untill you get all the skill capes

  3. run your server
